analyzed: atha khalu kratu mayaḥ puruṣaḥ yathā kratuḥ asmin loke puruṣaḥ bhavati tathā itas pretya bhavati
translated: Now, indeed, a person is made of will. As his will is in this world, so he becomes after death.

analyzed: sa kratum kurvīta
translated: He should form his will thus...

analyzed: punar tasya eva tripād amṛtasya brahmaṇaḥ nanta guṇavataḥ nanta śakteḥ aneka bheda upāsyasya viśiṣṭa guṇa śaktimat tvena upāsanam vidhitsan āha sarvam
translated: Again, intending to prescribe the meditation on Brahman, which has three feet, which is immortal, which has infinite qualities, which has infinite powers, which is to be meditated upon in many ways, as having distinguished qualities and powers, he says: This whole...

analyzed: khalu iti vākya alaṅkāra arthaḥ nipātaḥ
translated: The particle kha is for the purpose of ornamenting the sentence.

analyzed: idam jagat nāma rūpa vikṛtam pratyakṣa ādi viṣayam brahma kāraṇam vṛddhatama tvāt brahma
translated: This world, modified by name and form, which is the object of perception etc., is Brahman, the cause, because it is the oldest.

analyzed: katham sarvasya brahmatvam iti atas āha tad jalān iti
translated: How is it that the whole is Brahman? To this he says: That is born from water...

analyzed: tasmāt brahmaṇaḥ jātam tejaḥ banna ādi krameṇa sarvam
translated: Everything, from that Brahman, is born, in the order of fire, food, etc.

analyzed: atas tad jam
translated: Therefore, it is born from that.

original: tathā tenaiva jananakrameṇa pratilomatayā tasminneva brahmaṇi līyate tadātmatayā śliṣyata iti tallam /
analyzed: tathā tena eva janana krameṇa pratiloma tayā tasmin eva brahmaṇi līyate tad ātma tayā śliṣyate iti tallam
translated: And in the same manner, by the same order of birth, but in the reverse order, it dissolves into that Brahman, it becomes identified with that Self, and so it is called ‘laya’ (dissolution).

original: tathā tasminneva sthitikāle 'niti prāṇiti ceṣṭata iti /
analyzed: tathā tasmin eva sthiti kāle prāṇiti ceṣṭate iti
translated: And in the same manner, in the state of existence, it moves, it breathes, it acts.

analyzed: evam brahma ātma tayā triṣu kāleṣu aviśiṣṭam tad vyatirekeṇa agrahaṇāt
translated: Thus, being non-different from Brahman, it is not distinguished in the three times, because it is not apprehended apart from that.

analyzed: atas tat eva idam jagat
translated: Therefore, this very universe is that Brahman.

original: yathā cedaṃ tadevaikamadvitīyaṃ tathā ṣaṣṭhe vistareṇa vakṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: yathā ca idam tat eva ekam advitīyam tathā ṣaṣṭhe vistareṇa vakṣyāmaḥ
translated: And how this is that very one, the one without a second, that we shall explain in detail in the sixth chapter.

analyzed: yasmāt ca sarvam idam brahma
translated: And because this entire universe is Brahman,

original: ataḥ śānto rāgadveṣādidoṣarahitaḥ saṃyataḥ sanyattatsarvaṃ brahma tadvakṣyamāṇairguṇairupāsīta /
analyzed: atas śāntaḥ rāga dveṣa ādi doṣa rahitaḥ saṃyataḥ san yat tat sarvam brahma tat vakṣyamāṇaiḥ guṇaiḥ upāsīta
translated: therefore, being tranquil, free from the faults of passion, hatred, etc., being restrained, one should meditate upon that, upon all this, as Brahman, with the qualities that will be mentioned.

analyzed: katham upāsīta
translated: And how should one meditate upon it?

original: kratuṃ kurvīta kraturniścayo 'dhyavasāya evameva nānyathetyavicalaḥ pratyayastaṃ kratuṃ kurvītopāsītetyanena vyavahitena sambandhaḥ /
analyzed: kratum kurvīta kratuḥ niścayaḥ dhī avasāyaḥ evam eva na anyathā iti avicalaḥ pratyayaḥ tam kratum kurvīta upāsīta iti anena vyavahitena sambandhaḥ
translated: One should form the resolve, the determination, the conviction, ‘It is thus, not otherwise,’—one should form that resolve. The connection is with the word ‘upāsīta’ (should meditate) which is separated (from the verb ‘kuryāt’).

analyzed: kim punar kratu karaṇena kartavyam prayojanam
translated: But what is the purpose of forming the resolve?

original: kathaṃ vā kratuḥ kartavyaḥ kratukaraṇaṃ cābhipretārthasiddhisādhanaṃ kathamityasyārthasya pratipādanārthamathetyādigranthaḥ /
analyzed: katham vā kratuḥ kartavyaḥ kratu karaṇam ca abhipreta artha siddhi sādhanam katham iti asya arthasya pratipādana artham atha ityādi granthaḥ
translated: Or, how is a sacrifice to be performed? And how is the performance of a sacrifice a means to the accomplishment of the desired object? In order to explain this meaning, the text beginning with 'atha' is [used].

analyzed: atha khalu iti hetvarthaḥ
translated: 'Atha khalu' means for the purpose of stating a reason.

analyzed: yasmāt kratu mayaḥ kratu prāyaḥ dhī avasāya ātmakaḥ puruṣaḥ jīvaḥ
translated: Because a person, a living being, is composed of thought, consisting mostly of thought, having the nature of determination.

original: yathākraturyādṛśaḥ kraturasya so 'yaṃ yathākraturyathādhyavasāyo yādṛṅniścayo 'smiṃlloke jīvanniha puruṣo bhavati tatheto 'smāddehātpretya
analyzed: yathākratuḥ yādṛśaḥ kratuḥ asya saḥ yam yathākratuḥ yathā adhyavasāyaḥ yādṛś niścayaḥ smin loke jīvan iha puruṣaḥ bhavati tathā itas smāt dehāt pretya
translated: As is his thought, so is he. As is the thought of this person, so is he, as is his determination, as is his resolve, so is the person living in this world, in this life. In the same way, after leaving this body,

analyzed: mṛtvā bhavati
translated: after dying, he becomes.

analyzed: kratu anurūpa phala ātmakaḥ bhavati iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that he becomes of the nature of the fruit corresponding to his thought.

analyzed: evam hi etat śāsrataḥ dṛṣṭam
translated: For this is seen in the scriptures:

original: yaṃ yaṃ vāpi smaranbhāvaṃ tyajatyante kalevaramityādi /
analyzed: yam yam vā api smaran bhāvam tyajati ante kalevaram ityādi
translated: 'Whatever state he remembers when he leaves the body at the end,' and so on.

original: yata evaṃ vyavasthā śāsradṛṣṭātaḥ sa evaṃ jānankatuṃ kurvīta yādṛśaṃ kratuṃ vakṣyāmastam /
analyzed: yatas evam vyavasthā śāsra dṛṣṭā atas saḥ evam jānan katum kurvīta yādṛśam kratum vakṣyāmaḥ tam
translated: Since this is the established rule seen in the scriptures, knowing this, one should perform a sacrifice, of whatever kind we shall describe.

original: yata evaṃ śāsraprāmāṇyādupapadyate kratvanurūpaṃ phalamataḥ sa kartavyaḥ kratuḥ // //
analyzed: yatas evam śāsra prāmāṇyāt upapadyate kratu anurūpam phalam atas sa kartavyaḥ kratuḥ
translated: Since this is logically possible, the fruit corresponding to the thought, due to the authority of the scriptures, therefore that sacrifice should be performed.

analyzed: start chup
translated: Here begins the Chāndogya Upaniṣad.

original: manomayaḥ prāṇaśarīro bhārūpaḥ satyasaṃkalpa ākāśātmā sarvakarmā sarvakāmaḥ sarvagandhaḥ sarvarasaḥ sarvam idam abhyatto 'vāky anādaraḥ //
analyzed: manaḥ mayaḥ prāṇa śarīraḥ bhā rūpaḥ satya saṃkalpaḥ ākāśa ātmā sarva karmā sarva kāmaḥ sarva gandhaḥ sarva rasaḥ sarvam idam abhyattaḥ vākī anādaraḥ
translated: He is made of mind, has life as his body, is of the form of light, has true desires, has Ākāśa for his soul, is all action, all desire, all smell, all taste, and all this is contained in him, is without speech, and without honour.

analyzed: katham
translated: How?

analyzed: manaḥ mayaḥ manaḥ prāyaḥ
translated: He is made of mind, is mostly mind.

original: manute 'neneti manastatsvavṛttyā viṣayeṣu pravṛttaṃ bhavati tena manasā tanmayaḥ /
analyzed: manute nena iti manaḥ tad svavṛttyā viṣayeṣu pravṛttam bhavati tena manasā tad mayaḥ
translated: It is thought by this, therefore it is mind. It functions in the objects through its own function. He is made of that mind.

original: tathā pravṛtta iva tatprāyo nivṛtta iva ca /
analyzed: tathā pravṛttaḥ iva tad prāyaḥ nivṛttaḥ iva ca
translated: Similarly, as if engaged, he is mostly that. As if withdrawn, he is not.

original: ata eva prāṇaśarīraḥ prāṇo liṅgātmā vijñānakriyāśaktidvayasaṃmīrchitaḥ /
analyzed: atas eva prāṇa śarīraḥ prāṇaḥ liṅga ātmā vijñāna kriyā śakti dvaya saṃmīrchitaḥ
translated: For this very reason, he has life as his body. Life is the embodied soul, consisting of the union of the two powers of consciousness and action.

original: yo vai prāṇaḥ sā prajñā yā vā prajñā sa prāṇaḥiti śruteḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ vai prāṇaḥ sā prajñā yā vā prajñā sa prāṇaḥ iti śruteḥ
translated: As it is said in the śruti: That which is life is wisdom, and that which is wisdom is life.

analyzed: sa śarīram yasya sa prāṇa śarīraḥ
translated: He who has that as his body is one who has life as his body.

analyzed: manaḥ mayaḥ āṇa śarīra netā iti ca śruti antarāt
translated: And in another śruti: He who is made of mind, has life as his body, and is the leader.

analyzed: bhā rūpaḥ
translated: He is of the form of light.

original: bhā dīptiścaitanyalakṣaṇaṃ rūpaṃ yasya sa bhārūpaḥ /
analyzed: bhā dīptiḥ caitanya lakṣaṇam rūpam yasya sa bhā rūpaḥ
translated: He who has light, which is the characteristic of consciousness, as his form is one who is of the form of light.

analyzed: satya saṅkalpaḥ
translated: He has true desires.

original: satyā avitathāḥ saṅkalpā yasya so 'yaṃ satyasaṅkalpaḥ /
analyzed: satyāḥ avitathāḥ saṅkalpāḥ yasya saḥ yam satya saṅkalpaḥ
translated: He who has true, undeceiving desires is one who has true desires.

original: na yathā saṃsāriṇa ivānaikāntikaphalaḥ saṅkalpa īśvarasyetyarthaḥ /🔽anṛtena mithyāphalatvahetunā pratyūḍhatvātsaṅkalpasya mithyāphalatvam /
analyzed: na yathā saṃsāriṇaḥ iva anaikāntika phalaḥ saṅkalpaḥ īśvarasya iti arthaḥ  anṛtena mithyā phala tva hetunā pratyūḍha tvāt saṅkalpasya mithyā phala tvam
translated: The meaning is that God's resolve does not have a non-absolute result, unlike that of transmigrating beings.🔽The resolve is false-fruited because it is obstructed by untruth, the cause of false results.

analyzed: vakṣyati anṛtena hi pratyūḍhāḥ iti
translated: He will say, Indeed, they are obstructed by untruth.

analyzed: ākāśa ātmā
translated: Having the self of space.

original: ākāśa ivā'tmā svarūpaṃ yasya sa ākāśātmā /
analyzed: ākāśaḥ iva ātmā svarūpam yasya saḥ ākāśa ātmā
translated: He who has space as his self, his own nature, is one having the self of space.

analyzed: sarva gata tvam sūkṣma tvam ca ākāśa tulya tā īśvarasya
translated: God's being all-pervading, subtle, and devoid of form etc. is similar to space.

analyzed: sarva karmā
translated: All-action.

original: sarvaṃ viśvaṃ teneśvareṇa kriyata iti jagatsarvaṃ karmāsya sa sarvakarmā /
analyzed: sarvam viśvam tena īśvareṇa kriyate iti jagat sarvam karma asya sa sarva karmā
translated: The entire universe is created by that God, therefore the entire world is His action. He is all-action.

analyzed: sa hi sarvasya kartā iti śruteḥ
translated: For the scripture says, He is the maker of all.

analyzed: sarva kāmaḥ
translated: All-desire.

analyzed: sarve kāmāḥ doṣa rahitāḥ asya iti sarva kāmaḥ
translated: All desires are free from faults in Him, therefore He is all-desire.

analyzed: dharma viruddhaḥ bhūteṣu smṛteḥ
translated: The smrti says, I am desire in beings, contrary to dharma.

original: nanu kāmo 'smīti vacanādiha bahuvrīhistathā kāmo 'smītismṛtyartho vācyaḥ /
analyzed: nanu kāmaḥ smi iti vacanāt iha bahuvrīhiḥ tathā smi iti smṛti arthaḥ vācyaḥ
translated: But since it is said I am desire, here the bahuvrihi compound should be explained as meaning I have desire.

analyzed: sarva gandhaḥ
translated: All-scent.

original: sarve gandhāḥ sukhakarā asya so 'yaṃ sarvagandhaḥ /
analyzed: sarve gandhāḥ sukha karāḥ asya saḥ yam sarva gandhaḥ
translated: All scents bring pleasure to Him, therefore He is all-scent.

analyzed: puṇyaḥ gandhaḥ pṛthivyām iti smṛteḥ
translated: The smrti says, The sacred scent is on earth.

original: tathā rasā api vijñeyāḥ / apuṇyagandharasagrahaṇasya pāpmasambandhanimittatvaśravaṇāt /
analyzed: tathā rasāḥ api vijñeyāḥ apuṇya gandha rasa grahaṇasya pāpma sambandha nimitta tva śravaṇāt
translated: Similarly, the tastes should be known. Because it is heard that the apprehension of non-meritorious smell and taste is due to the connection with sin.

original: tasmāttenobhayaṃ jighrati surabhi ca durgandhi ca /
analyzed: tasmāt tena ubhayam jighrati surabhi ca durgandhi ca
translated: Therefore, he smells both, the fragrant and the foul-smelling.

analyzed: pāpmanā hi eṣu viddhaḥ iti śruteḥ
translated: Because it is heard: For he is pierced by sin.

analyzed: na ca pāpma saṃsarge īśvarasya
translated: And there is no contact with sin for God.

analyzed: avidyā ādi doṣasya anupapatteḥ
translated: Because ignorance and other faults are not possible for Him.

analyzed: sarvam idam jagat abhyāttaḥ abhivyāptaḥ
translated: This entire world is pervaded, completely filled.

analyzed: atateḥ vyāpti arthasya kartari niṣṭhā
translated: The suffix 'kṛt' is used in the sense of pervasion from the root 'atati'.

analyzed: tathāvākī ucyate naya iti vāc vāc eva vākaḥ
translated: Similarly, it is said: That by which one speaks, that is speech. Speech itself is vāka.

analyzed: dvā vaceḥ ghañ antasya karaṇe vāc
translated: Dvā is the instrumental case of the verbal root 'vac' with the suffix 'ghñ'.

original: sa yasya vidyate sa vākī na vākyavākī /
analyzed: sa yasya vidyate sa vākī na vākya vākī
translated: He who has that is vāki, not vākyavāki.

analyzed: vāc pratiṣedhaḥ ca atra upalakṣaṇa arthaḥ
translated: And the negation of speech here is for the purpose of illustration.

analyzed: gandha rasa ādi śravaṇāt īśvarasya prāptā nighrāṇa ādīni karaṇāni gandha ādi grahaṇāya
translated: The sense organs of God, such as the nose, etc., which are obtained for the apprehension of smell, etc., are spoken of as vāka.

analyzed: atas vāc pratiṣedhena pratiṣidhyante tāni
translated: Therefore, they are negated by the negation of speech.

original: apāṇipādo javano grahītā paśyatyacakṣuḥ sa śṛṇotyakarṇaḥityādimantravarṇāt /
analyzed: a pāṇi pādaḥ javanaḥ grahītā paśyati a cakṣuḥ sa śṛṇoti a karṇaḥ ityādi mantra varṇāt
translated: Because of the mantra passage: He who has no hands or feet is swift and grasping. He sees without eyes. He hears without ears. and so on.

analyzed: anādaraḥ saṃbhramaḥ
translated: Non-regard means being unconfused.

analyzed: a prāpta prāptau hi saṃbhramaḥ syāt an āpta kāmasya
translated: For confusion would arise from the non-attainment of what has not been attained, for one whose desires are not fulfilled.

analyzed: na tu āpta kāma tvāt nitya tṛptasya īśvarasya saṃbhramaḥ sti kvacid
translated: But for the Lord, who is always satisfied because His desires are fulfilled, there is no confusion anywhere.

analyzed: start chup
translated: Chandogya Upanishad

original: eṣa ma ātmā antarhṛdaye 'ṇīyān vrīher vā yavād vā sarṣapād vā śyāmākād vā śyāmākataṇḍulād vā /
analyzed: eṣa me ātmā antar hṛdaye ṇīyān vrīheḥ vā yavāt vā sarṣapāt vā śyāmākāt vā śyāmāka taṇḍulāt vā
translated: This Self of mine is within the heart, smaller than a corn of rice, smaller than a corn of barley, smaller than a mustard seed, smaller than a grain of millet.

original: eṣa ma ātmā antarhṛdaye jyāyān pṛthivyā jyāyān antarikṣāj jyāyān divo jyāyān ebhyo lokebhyaḥ // / / //
analyzed: eṣa me ātmā antar hṛdaye jyāyān pṛthivyāḥ jyāyān antarikṣāt jyāyān divaḥ jyāyān ebhyaḥ lokebhyaḥ
translated: This Self of mine is within the heart, greater than the earth, greater than the atmosphere, greater than the sky, greater than these worlds.

original: eṣa yathoktaguṇo me mamā'tmāntarhṛdaye hṛdayapuṇḍarīkasyāntarmadhye 'ṇīyānaṇutaro vrīhervā yavādvetyādyatyantasūkṣmatvapradarśanārtham
analyzed: eṣa yathā ukta guṇaḥ me mama ātmā antar hṛdaye hṛdaya puṇḍarīkasya antar madhye ṇīyān aṇutaraḥ vrīheḥ vā yavāt vā ityādi atyanta sūkṣmatva pradarśana artham
translated: This Self of mine, which has been described as having such qualities, is within the heart, in the middle of the lotus of the heart, smaller than a grain of rice, smaller than a grain of barley, etc., in order to show that it is extremely subtle.

original: śyāmākādvā śyāmākataṇḍulādveti paricchinnaparimāṇādaṇīyānityukte 'ṇuparimāṇatvaṃ prāptamāśaṅkyātastatpratiṣedhāyā'rabhate eṣa ma ātmāntarhṛdaye
analyzed: śyāmākāt vā śyāmāka taṇḍulāt vā iti paricchinna parimāṇāt aṇīyān iti ukte ṇu parimāṇa tvam prāptam āśaṅkya atas tad pratiṣedhāya ārabhate eṣa me ātmā antar hṛdaye  /
translated: From smaller than a grain of millet up to smaller than a grain of black mustard, it is said to be smaller than limited sizes, so it is understood to have atomic size. Fearing this, in order to refute that, he begins with This Self of mine is within the heart.

analyzed: jyāyān pṛthivyāḥ ityādinā
translated: From greater than the earth and so on.

analyzed: jyāyaḥ parimāṇāt ca jyāyaḥ tvam darśayan ananta parimāṇa tvam darśayati
translated: By showing that it is greater than even the greatest size, he shows that it has infinite size.

analyzed: start chup
translated: The Chāndogya Upaniṣad begins:

original: sarvakarmā sarvakāmaḥ sarvagandhaḥ sarvarasaḥ sarvam idam abhyatto 'vākyanādaraḥ /
analyzed: sarva karmā sarva kāmaḥ sarva gandhaḥ sarva rasaḥ sarvam idam abhyattaḥ vākya anādaraḥ
translated: He is all action, all desire, all smell, all taste, all this has entered into him, he is the inner controller, the undetectable.

analyzed: eṣa me ātmā antar hṛdaye
translated: This is my Self within the heart.

analyzed: etat brahma
translated: This is Brahman.

original: etam itaḥ pretyābhisaṃbhavitā asmīti yasya syād addhā na vicikitsā asti /
analyzed: etam itas pretya abhisaṃbhavitā asmi iti yasya syāt addhā na vicikitsā asti
translated: He who has this thought, 'I shall become that after death,' has no doubt.

original: iti ha smāha śāṇḍilyaḥ śāṇḍilyaḥ // / / //🔽manomaya ityādinā jyāyānebhyo lokebhya ityantena yathoktaguṇalakṣaṇa
analyzed: iti ha sma āha śāṇḍilyaḥ śāṇḍilyaḥ  manaḥ mayaḥ ityādinā jyāyānebhyaḥ lokebhyaḥ iti antena yathā ukta guṇa lakṣaṇa
translated: Thus indeed did Śāṇḍilya say.

original: īśvaro dhyeyo na tu tadguṇaviśiṣṭa eva yathā rājapuruṣamānaya citraguṃ vetyukte na
analyzed: īśvaraḥ dhyeyaḥ na tu tad guṇa viśiṣṭaḥ eva yathā rāja puruṣam ānaya citragum vā iti ukte na
translated: By the statement beginning with consisting of mind and ending with greater than these worlds, the God who possesses the qualities and characteristics mentioned is to be meditated upon, but not merely endowed with those qualities, just as when it is said Bring the king's man with the variegated horse, the bringing of the man is not affected by the mention of the horse's

original: viśeṣaṇaśyāpyānayane vyāpriyate tadvadihāpīti prāptamatastannivṛttyartha sarvakarmetyādi punarvacanam /
analyzed: viśeṣaṇa śyāpya ānayane vyāpriyate tadvat iha api iti prāptam atas tad nivṛtti artha sarva karma ityādi punarvacanam
translated: variegation. So it is here also. This being the prima facie view, the repetition beginning with all action is for the purpose of refuting that.

analyzed: tasmāt manaḥ maya tva ādi guṇa viśiṣṭaḥ eva īśvaraḥ dhyeyaḥ
translated: Therefore, God, who possesses the qualities of consisting of mind and so on, is to be meditated upon.

original: ata eva ṣaṣṭhasaptamayoriva tattvamasyātmaivedaṃ sarvamiti neha svārājye 'bhiṣiñcati /
analyzed: atas eva ṣaṣṭha saptamayoḥ iva tattvam asi ātmā eva idam sarvam iti na iha svārājye bhiṣiñcati
translated: For this very reason, as in the sixth and seventh (chapters), That art thou, All this is verily Brahman, he does not anoint (the student) in his own kingdom.

original: eṣa ma ātmaitadbrahmaitamitaḥ pratyābhisambhavitāsmīti liṅgānna tvātmaśabdena pratyagātmaivocyate /

translated: He, thus born, lives again and again, performing actions for the purpose of going and coming, like a water-wheel, or like a potter's wheel, spinning around in the horizontal plane, as long as the life-span allotted by his karma lasts.

analyzed: karmaṇi jñāne vā adhikṛtaḥ tam enam mṛtam itas smāt grāmāt agnaye gni artham ṛtvijaḥ haranti
translated: When his life-span is exhausted, when he dies, when he is dead, when he is directed by his karma to the other world, if he was entitled to Vedic rites or knowledge while living, then his relatives carry him from this village to the fire for the sake of the fire.

analyzed: putrāḥ vā antyakarmaṇe
translated: The sons carry him to the funeral rites.

analyzed: yatas eva itas āgataḥ gneḥ sakāśāt śraddhā ādi āhuti krameṇa
translated: From where he came, from the presence of the fire, by the process of offerings made with faith etc.

original: yataśca pañcabhyo 'gnibhyaḥ saṃbhūta utpanno bhavati tasmā evāgnaye haranti svāmeva yonimagnimāpādayantītyarthaḥ ////🔽iti cchāndogyopaniṣadi pañcamādhyāyasya navamaḥ khaṇḍaḥ
analyzed: yatas ca pañcabhyaḥ gnibhyaḥ saṃbhūtaḥ utpannaḥ bhavati tasmai eva agnaye haranti svām eva yonim agnim āpādayanti iti arthaḥ  iti chāndogyopaniṣadi pañcama adhyāyasya navamaḥ khaṇḍaḥ
translated: And since he is produced, born, from the five fires, therefore they carry him to the fire; the meaning is that they cause him to attain his own birthplace, the fire.

analyzed: start chup
translated: Thus ends the Ninth Section of the Fifth Chapter in the Chāndogya Upaniṣad.

analyzed: tat ye ittham viduḥ
translated: Now, those who know this,

original: ye ceme 'raṇye śraddhā tapa ity upāsate /
analyzed: ye ca ime raṇye śraddhā tapaḥ iti upāsate
translated: and those in the forest who worship faith and austerity,

analyzed: te rciṣam abhisaṃbhavanti
translated: they attain the light.

analyzed: arciṣaḥ haḥ
translated: From the light, the day.

analyzed: ahnaḥ āpūryamāṇapakṣam
translated: From the day, the waxing fortnight.

original: āpūryamāṇapakṣād yān ṣaḍ udaṅṅ eti māsāṃs tān // / / //
analyzed: āpūryamāṇapakṣāt yān ṣaṭ udaṅ eti māsān tān
translated: From the waxing fortnight, the six months when the sun moves north.

analyzed: māsebhyaḥ saṃvatsaram  saṃvatsarāt ādityam  ādityāt candramasam
translated: From the months, the year.🔽From the year, the sun.🔽From the sun, the moon.

analyzed: candramasaḥ vidyutam
translated: From the moon, the lightning.

analyzed: tat puruṣaḥ mānavaḥ
translated: That is the superhuman person.

analyzed: saḥ enān brahma gamayati
translated: He leads them to Brahman.

analyzed: eṣa deva yānaḥ panthāḥ iti
translated: This is the path of the gods.

original: vettha yadito 'dhi prajāḥ prayantītyayaṃ praśnaḥ pratyupasthito 'pākartavyatayā /
analyzed: vettha yat itas dhi prajāḥ prayanti iti ayam praśnaḥ pratyupasthitaḥ upākartavya tayā
translated: The question has come up to be answered: Do you know where beings go when they depart from here?

original: tattatra lokaṃ pratyutthitānāmadhikṛtānāṃ gṛhamedhināṃ ya itthamevaṃ yathoktaṃ pañcāgnidarśanaṃ
analyzed: tat tatra lokam pratyutthitānām adhikṛtānām gṛhamedhinām yaḥ ittham evam yathā uktam pañca agni darśanam
translated: Now, with reference to those householders who are entitled to stand up to receive the guest, those who know thus, i.e., in the manner described, the doctrine of the five fires,

original: dyulokādyagnibhyo vayaṃ krameṇa jātā agnisvarūpāḥ pañcāgnyātmāna ityevaṃ vidurjānīyuḥ /
analyzed: dyu loka ādi agnibhyaḥ vayam krameṇa jātāḥ agni svarūpāḥ pañca agni ātmānaḥ iti evam viduḥ jānīyuḥ
translated: know that we have been born in due order from the fires beginning with the heavenly world, and are of the nature of fire, having the five fires as our Self.

original: kathamavagamyata itthaṃ viduriti gṛhasthā evocyante nānya iti /
analyzed: katham avagamyate ittham viduḥ iti gṛhasthāḥ eva ucyante na anye iti
translated: How is it understood that those who know thus are said to be householders and not others?

original: gṛhasthānāṃ ye tvanitthaṃvidaḥ kevaleṣṭāpūrtadattaparāste dhūmādinā candraṃ gacchantīti vakṣyati /
analyzed: gṛhasthānām ye tu anitthaṃvidaḥ kevala iṣṭāpūrta datta parāḥ te dhūma ādinā candram gacchanti iti vakṣyati
translated: It will be said that those householders who do not know thus, who are devoted only to sacrifices and gifts, go to the moon by way of smoke, etc.

original: ye cāraṇyopalakṣitā vaikhānasāḥ parivrājakāśca śraddhātapa ityupāsate teṣāṃ cetthaṃvidbhiḥ
analyzed: ye ca araṇya upalakṣitāḥ vaikhānasāḥ parivrājakāḥ ca śraddhā tapaḥ iti upāsate teṣām ca itthaṃvidbhiḥ
translated: And it will be said that those who are characterized by the forest, the anchorites and wandering ascetics, who worship with faith and austerity, if they know thus,

original: sahārcirādinā gamanaṃ vakṣyati pāriśeṣyādagnihotrāhutisambandhācca gṛhasthā eva gṛhyanta itthaṃ viduriti /
analyzed: saha arciḥ ādinā gamanam vakṣyati pāriśeṣyāt agnihotra āhuti sambandhāt ca gṛhasthāḥ eva gṛhyante ittham viduḥ iti
translated: go by way of light, etc., along with those who know thus. By elimination and because of the connection with the oblations in the Agnihotra, only householders are understood to be those who know thus.

original: nanu brahmacāriṇo 'pyagṛhītā grāmaśrutyāraṇyaśrutyā vidyante kathaṃ pāriśeṣyasiddhiḥ /
analyzed: nanu brahmacāriṇaḥ pi agṛhītāḥ grāma śrutyā araṇya śrutyā vidyante katham pāriśeṣya siddhiḥ
translated: But even those who are not mentioned, the unmarried students, exist by the mention of the village and the forest. How is the establishment by elimination possible?

analyzed: na eṣa doṣaḥ
translated: This is not a fault.

analyzed: purāṇa smṛti prāmāṇyāt ūrdhvaretasām naiṣṭhika brahmacāriṇām uttareṇa arthāḥ iti na viśeṣa nirdeśa arhāḥ
translated: Since the scriptures, the Purāṇas and the Smṛtis, declare that the celibate students who have sublimated their sexual energy go by the northern path, they do not deserve a special mention.

original: nanūrdhvaretastvaṃ ceduttaramārgapratipattikāraṇaṃ purāṇasmṛtiprāmāṇyādiṣyata itthaṃvittvamanarthakaṃ prāptam / na /
analyzed: nanu ūrdhvaretaḥ tvam ced uttara mārga pratipatti kāraṇam purāṇa smṛti prāmāṇyāt iṣyate itthaṃvid tvam anarthakam prāptam na
translated: If the sublimation of sexual energy is accepted as the cause of going by the northern path on the authority of the Purāṇas and Smṛtis, then the knowledge of the truth of the Self becomes useless. No.

analyzed: gṛhasthān prati arthavat tvāt
translated: Because it is useful for the householders.

original: ye gṛhasthā anitthaṃvidasteṣāṃ svabhāvato dakṣiṇo dhūmādiḥ panthāḥ prasiddhasteṣāṃ yaṃ itthaṃ viduḥ saguṇaṃ vānyadbrahma viduḥ /
analyzed: ye gṛhasthāḥ anitthaṃvidaḥ teṣām svabhāvataḥ dakṣiṇaḥ dhūma ādiḥ panthāḥ prasiddhaḥ teṣām yam ittham viduḥ sa guṇam vā anyat brahma viduḥ
translated: For those householders who do not know the truth of the Self, the path of smoke etc. to the south is well-known by nature. For those who know the truth of the Self or know Brahman with qualities, the path to the north is useful.

original: atha yadu caivāsmiñśavyaṃ kurvanti yadi nārciṣamevaiti liṅgāduttareṇa te gacchanti /
analyzed: atha yat u ca eva asmin śavyam kurvanti yadi na arciṣam eva eti liṅgāt uttareṇa te gacchanti
translated: And whatever rites they perform on the dead body, if they do not go to the light, they go by the northern path, as indicated by the text.

original: nanūrdhvaretasāṃ gṛhasthānāṃ ca samāna āśramitva ūrdhvaretasāmevottareṇa pathā gamanaṃ na gṛhasthānāmiti na yuktamagnihotrādivaidikakarmabāhulye
analyzed: nanu ūrdhvaretasām gṛhasthānām ca samāne āśrami tve ūrdhvaretasām eva uttareṇa pathā gamanam na gṛhasthānām iti na yuktam agnihotra ādi vaidika karma bāhulye
translated: But if the householders and those who have sublimated their sexual energy are equal in being in the stage of celibacy, it is not proper that only those who have sublimated their sexual energy go by the northern path, not the householders, when there is an abundance of Vedic rites such as the Agnihotra.

analyzed: ca sati
translated: In spite of this,

analyzed: na eṣa doṣaḥ
translated: this is not a fault.

analyzed: a pūtāḥ hi te
translated: For they are impure.

analyzed: śatru mitra saṃyoga nimittam hi teṣām rāga dveṣau
translated: For their attachment and aversion arise from the connection with enemies and friends.

analyzed: tathā dharma adharmau hiṃsā anugraha nimittau
translated: Similarly, virtue and vice are the causes of injury and favour.

analyzed: hiṃsā anṛta māyā brahmacarya ādi ca bahu aśuddhi kāraṇam aparihāryam teṣām
translated: And for them, injury, untruth, deceit, celibacy, etc. are many causes of impurity that cannot be avoided.

analyzed: atas pūtāḥ
translated: Therefore, they are impure.

analyzed: a pūta tvāt na uttareṇa pathā gamanam
translated: Because of impurity, they do not go by the northern path.

original: hiṃsānṛtamāyābrahmacaryādiparihārācca śuddhātmāno hītare śatrumitrarāgadveṣādiparihārācca virajasasteṣāṃ yukta uttaraḥ panthāḥ /
analyzed: hiṃsā anṛta māyā brahmacarya ādi parihārāt ca śuddha ātmānaḥ hi itare śatru mitra rāga dveṣa ādi parihārāt ca virajasaḥ teṣām yuktaḥ uttaraḥ panthāḥ
translated: And because of avoiding injury, untruth, deceit, celibacy, etc., and because of avoiding enemies, friends, attachment, aversion, etc., the others are pure souls, and for them, the northern path is proper.

original: tathāca paurāṇikāḥ ye prajāmīṣire 'dhīrāste śmaśānāni bhejire /
analyzed: tathā ca paurāṇikāḥ ye prajām īṣire dhīrāḥ te śmaśānāni bhejire
translated: And thus the Purāṇikas say: Those who desired offspring went to the cremation grounds.

original: ye prajāṃ neṣire dhīrāste 'mṛtatvaṃ hi bhejire /
analyzed: ye prajām na iṣire dhīrāḥ te mṛta tvam hi bhejire
translated: Those wise ones who did not desire offspring went to immortality.

analyzed: iti āhuḥ
translated: Thus they say.

original: itthaṃvidāṃ gṛhasthānāmaraṇyavāsināṃ ca samānamārgatve 'mṛtatvaphale ca satyaraṇyavāsināṃ vidyānarthakyaṃ prāptam /
analyzed: itthaṃvidām gṛhasthānām araṇya vāsinām ca samāna mārga tve mṛta tva phale ca sati araṇya vāsinām vidyā ānarthakyam prāptam
translated: When the path and the fruit of immortality are the same for householders and forest dwellers who know this, it follows that the knowledge of forest dwellers is useless.

original: tathāca śrutivirodhaḥ /🔽na tatra dakṣiṇā yanti nāvidvāṃsastapasvinaḥiti /
analyzed: tathā ca śruti virodhaḥ  na tatra dakṣiṇāḥ yanti na a vidvāṃsaḥ tapasvinaḥ iti
translated: And thus there is a contradiction with the Śruti.🔽There the Dakṣiṇās do not go, nor the untaught ascetics.

original: sa enamavidito na bhunaktiiti ca viruddham / na /
analyzed: saḥ enam aviditaḥ na bhunakti iti ca viruddham na
translated: And He who is unknown does not enjoy this - this is contradictory. No.

analyzed: ābhūtasaṃplava sthānasya amṛta tvena vivakṣita tvāt
translated: Because immortality is intended as lasting until the dissolution of all beings.

original: tatraivoktaṃ paurāṇikaiḥābhūtasaṃptavaṃ sthānamamṛtatvaṃ hi bhāṣyate iti /🔽yaccā'tyantikamamṛtatvaṃ tadapekṣayāna tatra dakṣiṇā yanti sa enamavidito na bhunaktītyādyāḥ śrutaya ityato na virodhaḥ /
analyzed: tatra eva uktam paurāṇikaiḥ ābhūtasaṃptavam sthānam amṛta tvam hi bhāṣyate iti  yat ca ātyantikam amṛta tvam tad apekṣayā na tatra dakṣiṇāḥ yanti saḥ enam aviditaḥ na bhunakti ityādyāḥ śrutayaḥ iti atas na virodhaḥ
translated: And the same is said by the Purāṇas: “The state of being united with the Absolute is said to be immortality.”🔽And as for absolute immortality, in that case, the Vedic texts such as “The sacrificial fees do not go to him, he does not enjoy him who does not know this” are not contradictory.

original: na ca punarāvartantaitimaṃ mānavamāvartaṃ nā'vartantaityādiśrutivirodha iti cet / na /
analyzed: na ca punar āvartante eti imam mānavam āvartam na āvartanta etyādi śruti virodhaḥ iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that there is contradiction with the Vedic texts such as “They do not return to this human world,” “They do not return,” etc., it is not so.

original: imaṃ mānavamiti viśeṣaṇātteṣāmiha na punarāvṛttirastīti ca /🔽yadi hyekāntenaiva nā'varterannimaṃ mānavamiheti ca viśeṣaṇamanarthakaṃ syāt /
analyzed: imam mānavam iti viśeṣaṇāt teṣām iha na punarāvṛttiḥ asti iti ca  yadi hi ekāntena eva na āvarteran imam mānavam iha iti ca viśeṣaṇam anarthakam syāt
translated: Because of the qualification “this human world,” and because there is no return here for them.🔽For if they did not return absolutely, the qualification “this human world” would be meaningless.

analyzed: imam iha iti ākṛti mātram ucyate iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that only the form “this here” is being stated, it is not so.

analyzed: anāvṛtti śabdena eva nitya anāvṛtti arthasya pratīta tvāt ākṛti kalpanā anarthikā
translated: Because the meaning of eternal non-return is understood by the word “non-return,” the assumption of a form is useless.

analyzed: atas imam iha iti ca viśeṣaṇa arthavat tvāya anyatra āvṛttiḥ kalpanīyā
translated: Therefore, in order for the qualification “this here” to be meaningful, return elsewhere must be assumed.

original: na ca sadekamevādvitīyamityevaṃpratyayavatāṃ mūrdhanyayā nāḍyārcirādimārgeṇa gamanam /
analyzed: na ca sat ekam eva advitīyam iti evaṃpratyayavatām mūrdhanyayā nāḍyā arciḥ ādi mārgeṇa gamanam
translated: And for those who have the conviction “That is real, one without a second,” there is no going by the path of the light etc. through the nostril of Brahmā.

analyzed: brahma eva san brahma apyati
translated: Being Brahman only, he passes beyond even Brahman.

analyzed: tasmāt tat sarvam abhavat
translated: Therefore, all this became [manifest].

analyzed: na tasya prāṇāḥ utkrāmanti
translated: His vital breaths do not depart.

analyzed: atra eva samavanīyante ityādi śruti śatebhyaḥ
translated: They are merged here itself. Thus it is stated in hundreds of Vedic texts.

original: nanu tasmājjīvāduccikramiṣoḥ prāṇā notkrāmanti sahaiva gacchantītyayamarthaḥ kalpyata iti cet / na /
analyzed: nanu tasmāt jīvāt uccikramiṣoḥ prāṇāḥ na utkrāmanti saha eva gacchanti iti ayam arthaḥ kalpyate iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that the meaning to be inferred is that when the individual soul is about to depart, the vital breaths do not depart but go along with it, that is not so.

analyzed: atra eva samavanīyante iti viśeṣaṇa ānarthakyāt
translated: Because the qualification they are merged here itself would be meaningless.

original: sarve prāṇā anūtkrāmantīti ca prāṇairgamanasya prāptatvāt /
analyzed: sarve prāṇāḥ anūtkrāmanti iti ca prāṇaiḥ gamanasya prāpta tvāt
translated: And because it is already established that all the vital breaths depart along with the soul.

analyzed: tasmāt utkrāmanti iti anāśaṅkā eva eṣā
translated: Therefore, the doubt itself does not arise that they depart.

original: yadāpi mokṣasya saṃsāragativailakṣaṇyātprāṇānāṃ jīvena sahāgamāśṅkya tasmānnotkrāmantītyucyate tadāpyatraiva samavanīyanta iti viśeṣaṇamanarthakaṃ 🔽syāt /
analyzed: yadā api mokṣasya saṃsāra gati vailakṣaṇyāt prāṇānām jīvena sahāgama āśṅkya tasmāt na utkrāmanti iti ucyate tadā api atra eva samavanīyante iti viśeṣaṇam anarthakam  syāt
translated: Even when liberation is considered to be different from the course of worldly existence, and it is said that the vital breaths do not depart along with the soul, even then the qualification they are merged here itself would be meaningless.

original: na ca prāṇairviyuktasya gatirupapadyate jīvatvaṃ vā /
analyzed: na ca prāṇaiḥ viyuktasya gatiḥ upapadyate jīva tvam vā
translated: And for one separated from the vital breaths, neither departure nor the state of being a living being is possible.

original: sarvagatatvātsadātmano niravayavatvātprāṇasambandhamātrameva hyagnivisphuliṅgavajjīvatvabhedakāraṇamityatastadviyoge jīvatvaṃ gatirvā na śakyā 🔽parikalpayituṃ śrutayaścetpramāṇam /
analyzed: sarvagata tvāt sat ātmanaḥ niravayava tvāt prāṇa sambandha mātram eva hi agni visphuliṅga vat jīva tva bheda kāraṇam iti atas tad viyoge jīva tvam gatiḥ vā na śakyā  / parikalpayitum śrutayaḥ ced pramāṇam
translated: Because the Self is all-pervading, and because it is without parts, the mere connection with the vital breaths is the only cause of the difference of the individual souls, just as the sparks of fire are the cause of the difference of the individual fires. Therefore, when that connection is severed, the state of being an individual soul or the going of the soul cannot be imagined, if the scriptures are the authority.

original: na sato 'ṇuravayavaḥ sphuṭito jīvākhyaḥ sadrūpaṃ chidrīkurvangacchatīti śakyaṃ kalpayitum /
analyzed: na sataḥ ṇuḥ avayavaḥ sphuṭitaḥ jīva ākhyaḥ sat rūpam chidrīkurvan gacchati iti śakyam kalpayitum
translated: It cannot be imagined that a part of the existent, called the individual soul, is split off and goes, piercing through the existent.

original: tasmāttayordhvamāyannamṛtatvametiiti saguṇabrahmopākasya prāṇaiḥ saha nāḍyā gamanaṃ sāpekṣameva cāmṛtatvaṃ na sākṣānmokṣa iti gamyate /
analyzed: tasmāt tayā ūrdhvam āyan amṛta tvam eti iti sa guṇa brahma upākasya prāṇaiḥ saha nāḍyāḥ gamanam sa apekṣam eva ca amṛta tvam na sākṣāt mokṣaḥ iti gamyate
translated: Therefore, it is understood that the one who has realized Brahman with qualities goes upwards through the vital breaths in the nāḍīs, and that immortality is dependent on that, and is not direct liberation.

original: tadaparājitā pūstadairaṃ madīyaṃ saraḥityādyuktvāteṣāmevaiṣa brahmalokaḥiti viśeṣamāt /
analyzed: tat aparājitā pūḥ tad airam madīyam saraḥ ityādi uktvā teṣām eva eṣa brahma lokaḥ iti
translated: After stating That is my imperishable, eternal lake, etc., it is specified That is indeed the world of Brahman for them.

original: ataḥ pañcāgnivido gṛhasthā ye ceme 'raṇye vānaprasthāḥ parivrājakāśca saha naiṣṭhikabrahmacāribhiḥ śraddhā tapa ityevamādyupāsate śraddadhānāstapasvinaścetyarthaḥ
analyzed: atas pañcāgni vidaḥ gṛhasthāḥ ye ca ime raṇye vānaprasthāḥ parivrājakāḥ ca saha naiṣṭhika brahmacāribhiḥ śraddhā tapaḥ iti evamādi upāsate śraddadhānāḥ tapasvinaḥ ca iti arthaḥ
translated: Therefore, those householders who know the five fires, and those who are in the forest as forest hermits and wandering ascetics along with lifelong celibates, who worship with faith, austerity, and so on, meaning those who have faith and are austere,

analyzed: upāsana śabdaḥ tātparyārthaḥ
translated: the word worship has the meaning of intentness.

analyzed: iṣṭāpūrte dattam iti upāsate iti yadvat
translated: Just as they worship the ritual and charity as the means of attaining heaven.

original: śrutyantarādye ca satyaṃ brahma hiraṇyagarbhākhyamupāsate te sarve 'rciṣamarcirabhimāninīṃ devatāmabhisambhavanti pratipadyante /
analyzed: śruti antara ādye ca satyam brahma hiraṇyagarbha ākhyam upāsate te sarve rciṣam arciḥ abhimāninīm devatām abhisambhavanti pratipadyante
translated: And those who worship the true Brahman called Hiranyagarbha, all of them attain the deity embodied in the light.

analyzed: samānam anyat caturtha gati vyākhyānena
translated: The other part is the same as in the explanation of the fourth path.

original: eṣa devayānaḥ panthā vyākhyātaḥ satyalokāvasāno nāṇḍādbahiḥ /
analyzed: eṣa deva yānaḥ panthāḥ vyākhyātaḥ satya loka avasānaḥ na aṇḍāt bahis
translated: This path of the gods has been explained, ending with the world of truth, outside the egg.

translated: Because of the mantra verse He goes between father and mother (RV 10.90.4), etc.
